The RN4020 module must configured to use the MLDP mode to communicate with the MLDP Terminal application.

This can be done with the following commands:

SF,2 to reset the module to original factory settings.
SR,36000800 to enable and auto enter MLDP mode, auto advertise using undirected advertisements, and turn on UART flow control.
SN,Bob to set the name of the module (up to 6 characters).
R,1 to reboot and save settings.

See the RN4020 Bluetooth Low Energy Module Command Reference User\'s Guide on the Microchip website for more information.

Note that the Android device may cache old settings. Flush the old settings by pairing and unpairing (forgetting) the RN4020 in the Bluetooth settings.
